test.description: Do all contigs have the correct number of mappings?

test.format: Contig {0,number,#} created at {1,time} on {1,date}, length {2,number,#}bp, in project {3}, has nreads=0

test.query: select R.readname,DR.hits,CC.contig_id,P.name,CC.length,CC.nreads,CC.created,M.coffset,M.direction from DUPLICATEREADS DR left join (READNAME R,SEQ2READ SR,SEQ2CONTIG M,CURRENTCONTIGS CC,PROJECT P) on (DR.read_id=R.read_id) where R.read_id=SR.read_id and SR.seq_id=M.seq_id and M.contig_id=CC.contig_id and CC.project_id=P.project_id order by DR.read_id asc,CC.contig_id asc
test.format: Read {0} appears {1,number,#} times and is in current contig {2,number,#} ({3}, {4,number,#} bp, {5,number,#} reads, created at {6,time} on {6,date}) from {7,number,#} in {8} sense

test.description: Are there any current contigs which share duplicate reads?
test.query: select CCA.contig_id,CCA.length,CCA.nreads,CCA.created,PA.name, CCB.contig_id,CCB.length,CCB.nreads,CCB.created,PB.name, count(*) as `links` from CURRENTCONTIGS CCA,PROJECT PA,SEQ2CONTIG MA,SEQ2READ SRA, CURRENTCONTIGS CCB,PROJECT PB,SEQ2CONTIG MB,SEQ2READ SRB where CCA.contig_id=MA.contig_id and MA.seq_id=SRA.seq_id and SRA.read_id=SRB.read_id and SRB.seq_id=MB.seq_id and MB.contig_id=CCB.contig_id and CCA.contig_id < CCB.contig_id and CCA.project_id=PA.project_id and CCB.project_id=PB.project_id group by CCA.contig_id,CCB.contig_id order by CCA.contig_id asc,CCB.contig_id asc
test.format: Contigs {0,number,#} ({4}, {1,number,#} bp, {2,number,#} reads, created at {3,time} on {3,date}) and {5,number,#} ({9}, {6,number,#} bp, {7,number,#} reads, created at {8,time} on {8,date}) share {10,number,#} {10,choice,1#read|1<reads} in common.

test.description: Do all sequences have a corresponding sequence-to-read mapping?
test.format: Sequence {0,number,#} has no associated sequence-to-read mapping

test.description: Do all reads have valid sequence data?
Do all reads have a template?
test.query: select RI.read_id,RN.readname from (READINFO RI left join READNAME RN using (read_id)) left join TEMPLATE using (template_id) where name is null

test.description: Do all templates have a ligation?
Do all ligations have a clone?
